UMBC Portfolio Reviewers?

Welcome to Grant Stavely's home page release 2. The actual word based content of this page has changed very little from it's predecessor, Quasilateral, but the site graphics and layout have been completely revamped. Because I am teaching myself, insight after insight continues to advance my abilities and hence this site's possibilities.

Constant tweaking punctuated by major updates is my goal. If server space is available to me, I will leave dumped designs online as I have done with Quasilateral in the true style of the original "internet".

From now on, updates will be listed here as to the advances I have made and the additions to beginnigs so that I can give some sense of the progression made since the beginning of June when I first sat down to sketch out a design.

This site is best viewed on a computer with a monitor. Specifially, this site is best viewed on my computer and monitor, not because they are incredible pieces of hardware (they aren't) but because I created the web site on them. The images load faster, the window is the right size, and I am here to explain away any mistakes. The text you are reading probably looks a tad different from the way it looks for me in Windows98 running IE 5.0 with the link underlining turned off at a screen resolution of 600x800 at true color (millions of them in fact) and there is a possiblility that it looks a lot different. Cross-platform support is my next project - the Mac donation hotline is open and operators are standing by.

7.19.99 - I have been reading all the literature I can get my hands on concerning cascading style sheets and graphic web design to speed up page loading. The style sheet ref page has been revamped and a new logo is in the works which can be seen on the bottom of all the pages now. I am still in the process of tweaking it both compositionally and file size reduction. Stay tuned...


Grant Stavely
